entry.title: Wing FTP Server NULL-byte Authentication Bypass
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Wing FTP Server NULL-byte Authentication Bypass

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2025-47812

漏洞类型： 命令执行

漏洞等级： 高危

漏洞描述： Wing FTP Server 允许通过NULL字节（%00）截断漏洞进行任意Lua代码注入（CVE-2025-47812）。提供%00作为用户名，使C++认证例程仅验证前缀，而完整字符串未经过滤写入会话文件，随后以root/SYSTEM权限执行，导致远程代码执行。

产品厂商： Wing FTP Server

产品名称： Wing FTP Server

来源： https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/blob/1a4a15e83b5262481fd970cf1a0f94dfd0933437/modules%2Fexploits%2Fmulti%2Fhttp%2Fwingftp_null_byte_rce.rb

类型： rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues

entry.title: Pillow vulnerability can cause write buffer overflow on BCn encoding
entry.content:
链接： https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xg8h-j46f-w952

仓库 Star： 12878

CVSS 评分： 7.1

参考链接：

  • https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/security/advisories/GHSA-xg8h-j46f-w952

  • https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/9041

  • https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/releases/tag/11.3.0

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xg8h-j46f-w952

描述：

There is a heap buffer overflow when writing a sufficiently large (>64k encoded with default settings) image in the DDS format due to writing into a buffer without checking for available space.

This only affects users who save untrusted data as a compressed DDS image.

  • Unclear how large the potential write could be. It is likely limited by process segfault, so it’s not necessarily deterministic. It may be practically unbounded.
  • Unclear if there’s a restriction on the bytes that could be emitted. It’s likely that the only restriction is that the bytes would be emitted in chunks of 8 or 16.

This was introduced in Pillow 11.2.0 when the feature was added.
entry.summary: 链接： https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xg8h-j46f-w952

entry.title: Wing FTP Server 未授权远程代码执行漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Wing FTP Server 未授权远程代码执行漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2025-47812

漏洞类型： 命令执行

漏洞等级： 严重

漏洞描述： Wing FTP Server 7.4.4之前的版本存在未授权远程代码执行漏洞（CVE-2025-47812）。该漏洞源于登录时对’username’参数中的NULL字节处理不当，导致Lua代码注入到会话文件中。这些恶意构造的会话文件在访问认证功能（如/dir.html）时被执行，从而在服务器上以提升的权限执行任意命令。

产品厂商： wftpserver

产品名称： Wing FTP Server

影响版本： * < 7.4.4

来源： https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/blob/668bb1550dfcec121585609c89d1c0163b8b505c/http%2Fcves%2F2025%2FCVE-2025-47812.yaml

类型： projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

entry.title: ISPConfig language_editphp PHP代码注入漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： ISPConfig language_edit.php PHP代码注入漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2023-46818

漏洞类型： 代码注入

漏洞等级： 高危

漏洞描述： ISPConfig的language_edit.php文件存在PHP代码注入漏洞。当admin_allow_langedit设置启用时，认证的管理员可以通过语言编辑器界面注入任意PHP代码。此模块会自动检查admin_allow_langedit权限是否启用，并尝试启用它（如果它被禁用，需要具有系统配置访问权限的管理员凭据）。漏洞利用通过将PHP有效负载注入语言文件，然后在访问该文件时执行。有效负载经过base64编码并使用PHP的file_put_contents函数写入。

产品厂商： ISPConfig

产品名称： ISPConfig

影响版本： version < 3.2.11p1

来源： https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/blob/03e943726a3a1e43d12192ad1726a9c25afabdf2/modules%2Fexploits%2Flinux%2Fhttp%2Fispconfig_lang_edit_php_code_injection.rb

类型： rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues

POC详情

entry.title: sudo chroot Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： sudo chroot Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2025-32463

漏洞类型： 权限提升

漏洞等级： 高危

漏洞描述： CVE-2025-32463是一个本地权限提升漏洞，影响sudo版本1.9.14至1.9.17。该漏洞允许本地非特权用户通过滥用sudo中的--chroot（-R）功能，即使没有为该用户定义特定的sudo规则，也能将权限提升至root。漏洞源于sudo在执行chroot()结合名称服务切换（NSS）查找时的安全行为不当。当sudo chroot进入一个由非特权用户控制的可写目录时，它将使用chroot内的NSS配置解析用户信息，导致以root权限加载任意共享对象。通过在伪造的chroot环境中植入恶意共享对象（如libnss_/malicious.so.2），攻击者可以触发其与sudo的执行，从而实现权限提升。此问题在sudo版本1.9.14中引入，并在版本1.9.17p1中修复，其中chroot功能被弃用。

产品厂商： sudo

产品名称： sudo

影响版本： 1.9.14 <= version <= 1.9.17

来源： https://github.com/K1tt3h/CVE-2025-32463-POC

类型： CVE-2025:github search

仓库文件

  • CVE-2025-32463-POC.sh
  • LICENSE
  • README.md

来源概述

CVE-2025-32463 – Sudo chroot Privilege Escalation (PoC)

This repository contains a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2025-32463, a local privilege escalation vulnerability in sudo versions 1.9.14 through 1.9.17. The vulnerability allows a local unprivileged user to escalate privileges to root by abusing the --chroot (-R) feature in sudo, even when no specific sudo rules are defined for that user.

Vulnerability Overview

CVE-2025-32463 arises from unsafe behavior in sudo when performing chroot() combined with Name Service Switch (NSS) lookups during command matching. When sudo chroots into a directory that is writable and controlled by an unprivileged user, it will resolve user information using the NSS configuration inside the chroot. This leads to arbitrary shared object loading with root privileges.

By planting a malicious shared object (e.g., libnss_/malicious.so.2) in the fake chroot environment, an attacker can trigger its execution with sudo, resulting in privilege escalation.

This issue was introduced in sudo version 1.9.14 and is patched in version 1.9.17p1, where the chroot feature was deprecated.

Affected Versions

  • Vulnerable: sudo 1.9.14 to 1.9.17
  • Patched: sudo 1.9.17p1 and later
  • Not affected: Legacy versions prior to 1.9.14 (chroot feature did not exist)

PoC File Description

This repository includes a single file:

  • CVE-2025-32463-POC.sh
    A self-contained bash script that demonstrates the exploit.
    It creates a fake chroot environment, builds a malicious NSS module, and uses sudo -R to trigger the vulnerability.

Requirements

  • A Linux system with sudo version between 1.9.14 and 1.9.17
  • gcc and basic build tools installed

Vulnerability Discovery Credit

CVE-2025-32463 was discovered by Rich Mirch of the Stratascale Cyber Research Unit (CRU).

The Stratascale CRU team conducted detailed analysis of the sudo chroot implementation and identified the vulnerability as part of ongoing research into privileged Linux utilities. Their work included discovery, exploitation, responsible disclosure to the sudo maintainer, and coordination with MITRE for CVE assignment.

Special thanks to Todd Miller, the maintainer of sudo, for working with the researchers to triage and patch the vulnerability in version 1.9.17p1.

For the full technical breakdown of the vulnerability, see the original disclosure:

  • https://www.stratascale.com/vulnerability-alert-CVE-2025-32463-sudo-chroot

Disclaimer

This project is provided for educational and research purposes only.

By using any part of this repository, you agree that:

  • You will not use this code or technique to gain unauthorized access to systems you do not own or have explicit permission to test.
  • The author of this repository (K1tt3h) assumes no responsibility or liability for any misuse, damage, or consequences caused by this PoC or related material.

Use this code at your own risk.
entry.summary:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： sudo chroot Privilege Escalation Vulner

entry.title: Brother Printers 默认管理员密码认证绕过漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Brother Printers 默认管理员密码认证绕过漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2024-51978

漏洞类型： 弱口令

漏洞等级： 严重

漏洞描述： 通过泄露目标设备的序列号，远程攻击者可以生成目标设备的默认管理员密码。目标设备可能通过未经认证的HTTP、HTTPS、IPP、SNMP或PJL请求泄露其序列号。

产品厂商： Brother

产品名称： Brother Printers

搜索语法： app=”brother-Printer”

来源： https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12517

类型： projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

来源概述

Is there an existing template for this?

  • I have searched the existing templates.

Nuclei Template

Relevant dumped responses

Anything else?

The template fails quietly if target web site does not return a CSRF token in its response checked in this snippet:

extractors:  - type: regex    part: body    name: logbox    group: 1    regex:      - 'id="LogBox" name="(.*?)"'    internal: true  - type: regex    part: body    name: csrf    group: 1    regex:      - 'id="CSRFToken" name="CSRFToken" value="(.*?)"'    internal: true

Example output:
[WRN] [CVE-2024-51978] Could not make http request for https://xxx.xx.xx.xx: unresolved variables found: urlencode(csrf)

A website which does not return any token can still be vulnerable. As you can see in the first screenshot, it does not find the vulnerability

When i send CSRFToken value as empty, it does find it

The template should handle both situations
entry.summary:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Brother Printers 默认管理员密码认证绕过漏洞

<

entry.title: CVE-2024-51978
entry.content:
描述： An unauthenticated attacker who knows the target device’s serial number, can generate the default administrator password for the device. An unauthenticated attacker can first discover the target device’s serial number via CVE-2024-51977 over HTTP/HTTPS/IPP, or via a PJL request, or via an SNMP request.

Rapid7 disclosed this authentication bypass vulnerability on June 25, 2025. A the time of disclosure, this authentication bypass is known to affect 695 models across Brother’s range of printer, scanner, and label maker devices.

The premise of the authentication bypass is as follows; a remote unauthenticated attacker can leak a vulnerable target device’s serial number via one of several means HTTP/HTTPS/IPP (via CVE-2024-51977), or SNMP, or PJL. The serial number can be transformed into the target devices default administrator password (i.e. the complex password found on the sticker attached to the device). If the device has not had its default admin password changed, the attacker can then successfully login to the target device with this default credential.

I have tagged this CVE with “Difficult to patch”, as Brother has indicated that this vulnerability cannot be fully remediated in firmware, and has required a change to the manufacturing process of all affected models.

For more information you can read the Rapid7 disclosure blog here, or a detailed technical analysis of the authentication bypass can be found in the Rapid7 white paper “Print Scan Hacks: Identifying multiple vulnerabilities across multiple Brother devices” (PDF).
entry.summary: 描述： An unauthenticated attacker who knows the target device’s serial number, can generate the default administrator pass

漏洞描述： WordPress的Opal Estate Pro – Property Management and Submission插件（用于FullHouse - Real Estate Responsive WordPress主题）在1.7.5及之前的所有版本中存在权限提升漏洞。攻击者可以通过发送特制的注册请求来获取管理员权限。

仓库文件

  • LICENSE
  • NxPloitedCVE.PNG
  • README.md
  • requirements.txt

来源概述

🛡️ CVE-2025-6934 - Unauthenticated Privilege Escalation in Opal Estate Pro

📝 Description

The Opal Estate Pro – Property Management and Submission plugin for WordPress, used by the FullHouse - Real Estate Responsive WordPress Theme, is vulnerable to Privilege Escalation in all versions up to and including 1.7.5.

  • CVE ID: CVE-2025-6934
  • CVSS Score: 9.8 (Critical)
  • Published: June 30, 2025

⚙️ Script Information

This Python exploit automates the privilege escalation process by:

  • Verifying the vulnerable plugin version via readme.txt.
  • Fetching the required nonce from the registration page.
  • Sending a crafted registration request to gain Administrator access.

🚀 Usage Example

📤 Sample Output

🛠️ Arguments & Help

⚠️ Disclaimer

This script is for educational and authorized security testing purposes only.
Unauthorized use of this tool against targets without consent is strictly prohibited.

By: Khaled_alenazi (Nxploited)

漏洞信息

漏洞类型： 远程代码执行

漏洞描述： 远程桌面服务（原终端服务）存在一个远程代码执行漏洞，由未经认证的攻击者通过RDP发送特制请求引起，允许远程攻击者执行任意代码。利用此漏洞需要网络访问RDP端口。

产品厂商： Microsoft

产品名称： Remote Desktop Services

搜索语法： cpe:”cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7”

来源： https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12278

类型： projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

来源概述

Description:

Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) contains a remote code execution caused by specially crafted requests sent over RDP by unauthenticated attackers, letting remote attackers execute arbitrary code, exploit requires network access to RDP port.

Severity: Critical

KEV: True

Shodan Query: cpe:"cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and won’t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

entry.title: Sophos XG Firewall SQL注入漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Sophos XG Firewall SQL注入漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2020-12271

漏洞类型： SQL注入

漏洞等级： 严重

漏洞描述： 在Sophos XG Firewall设备上发现了一个SQL注入问题，影响了配置了管理（HTTPS）服务或在WAN区域暴露了用户门户的设备。成功的攻击可能导致远程代码执行，泄露本地设备管理员、门户管理员和用于远程访问的用户账户的用户名和哈希密码（但不包括外部Active Directory或LDAP密码）。

产品厂商： Sophos

产品名称： Sophos XG Firewall

影响版本： 17.0, 17.1, 17.5, 18.0 before 2020-04-25

搜索语法： http.title:”sophos”

来源： https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12499

类型： projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

来源概述

Description:

A SQL injection issue was found in SFOS 17.0, 17.1, 17.5, and 18.0 before 2020-04-25 on Sophos XG Firewall devices, as exploited in the wild in April 2020. This affected devices configured with either the administration (HTTPS) service or the User Portal exposed on the WAN zone. A successful attack may have caused remote code execution that exfiltrated usernames and hashed passwords for the local device admin(s), portal admins, and user accounts used for remote access (but not external Active Directory or LDAP passwords)

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2020/04/26/asnarok/

KEV: True

Shodan Query: http.title:"sophos"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and won’t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.
